citations.narrative:
The last recorded physical examination performed by the attending veterinarian for the 25 adult dogs was on 07/27/24.
The facility representative confirmed that the last physical examination was performed on 07/27/24. Physical examination
of every dog on the facility is necessary to evaluate each dog for its overall internal and external physical health. In
addition, the physical examination will be able to evaluate the overall condition and health of the hair coat, feet, ears, and
eyes. The licensee must have a complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian
not less than once every 12 months.
Correct by 12/24/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The last recorded physical examination performed by the attending veterinarian for the 25 adult dogs was on 07/27/24. 
The facility representative confirmed that the last physical examination was performed on 07/27/24. Physical examination 
of every dog on the facility is necessary to evaluate each dog for its overall internal and external physical health. In 
addition, the physical examination will be able to evaluate the overall condition and health of the hair coat, feet, ears, and 
eyes. The licensee must have a complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian 
not less than once every 12 months.  
 
Correct by 12/24/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
End Section
